TextEnglish: Good morning! My name is Ann, and I'm an admissions nurse.
TextGerman: Guten Morgen! Ich heiße Frau Müller und ich unterstzütze Sie bei der Aufnahme.

TextEnglish: Can I start by asking your full name?
TextGerman: Darf ich nach Ihrem vollständigen Namen fragen?

TextEnglish: Good morning. I'm Tom Stevens.
TextGerman: Guten Morgen! Mein Name ist Thomas Stegmann.

TextEnglish: What’s your date of birth?
TextGerman: Wie ist Ihr Geburtsdatum?

TextEnglish: 2 June 2005.
TextGerman: der 2. Juni 2005

TextEnglish: Where do you live, Mr Stevens? What’s your address?
TextGerman: Wo wohnen Sie Herr Stegmann? Wie lautet Ihre Anschrift?

TextEnglish: It’s apartment 7, 22 Park Street, Düsseldorf.
TextGerman: Charlottenstraße 49, 40210 Düsseldorf

TextEnglish: Thank you, Mr Stevens. What is your phone number?
TextGerman: Vielen Dank Herr Stegmann. Und wie ist Ihre Telefonnummer?

TextEnglish: Mr Stevens, who is your next of kin? A person that we could call in an emergent case.
TextGerman: Herr Stegmann, haben Sie Antgehörige, die wir in einem Notfall anrufen könnten?

TextEnglish: Well, I haven’t thought of that. I guess, it’s my mom, Betany Stevens. The same phone number. Or my dad, John Stevens.
TextGerman: Naja, darüber habe ich noch nicht nachgedacht. Ich schätze, es ist meine Mutter, Bettina Stegmann. Dieselbe Telefonnummer. Oder mein Vater, Jonah Stegmann.

TextEnglish: Do you have any allergies?
TextGerman: Sind Sie allergisch gegen etwas?

TextEnglish: Food? Medication?
TextGerman: Gegen Essen oder Medikamente?

TextEnglish: Not very severe, but I sometimes feel allergic to some kinds of seafood.
TextGerman: Nicht sehr stark, aber ich reagiere manchmal allergisch auf einige Arten von Meeresfrüchten.

TextEnglish: Noted. Have you ever been to the hospital for any treatment? Do you have any chronic diseases?
TextGerman: Alles klar. Waren Sie schon einmal zur Behandlung im Krankenhaus? Haben Sie chronische Krankheiten?

TextEnglish: No, none of that.
TextGerman: Nein, nichts davon.

TextEnglish: Do you take any medication on regular basis?
TextGerman: Nehmen Sie regelmäßig Medikamente ein?

TextEnglish: No, just some painkillers. One or two pills during last night.
TextGerman: Nein, nur paar Schmerztabletten.  Eine oder zwei in der letzten Nacht.

TextEnglish: Mr. Stevens, how are you feeling?
TextGerman: Herr Stegmann, wie fühlen Sie sich?

TextEnglish: What is the reason to come here?
TextGerman: Aus welchem Grund sind Sie zu uns gekommen?

TextEnglish: I've got this sharp, stabbing pain in the lower right side of my stomach that's been bothering me for a while. It's consistent and not going away.
TextGerman: Ich habe seit einiger Zeit scharfe, stechende Schmerzen im rechten Unterbauch. Sie sind durchgehend und gehen nicht weg.

TextEnglish: I'm concerned it might be something like appendicitis, so I came to get it checked out. It's definitely not something I've experienced before.
TextGerman: Ich befürchte, dass es eine Blinddarmentzündung sein könnte, also bin ich hierher gekommen, um es untersuchen zu lassen. Das ist definitiv nichts, was ich schon mal erlebt habe.

TextEnglish: Thank you. Mr Stevens. You will be taken care of right away. Please, sit still and try not to make any sudden movements.
TextGerman: Ich danke Ihnen, Herr Stegmann. Man kümmert sich sofort um Sie. Bleiben Sie bitte auf Ihrem Platz und machen Sie keine plötzlichen Bewegungen.

TextEnglish: Now, I'll need to take your vital signs for our examination sheet.
TextGerman: Jetzt muss ich Ihre Vitaldaten für unseren Untersuchungsbogen aufnehmen.

TextEnglish: Okay
TextGerman: Okay

TextEnglish: Let's start with your blood pressure.
TextGerman: Lass uns mit dem Blutdruck anfangen.

TextEnglish: Okay
TextGerman: Okay

TextEnglish: Do you have any known issues or concerns related to your blood pressure?
TextGerman: Haben Sie irgendwelche bekannten Probleme oder Sorgen bezüglich Ihres Blutdrucks?

TextEnglish: No, not that I'm aware of.
TextGerman: Nichts, dass ich wüsste

TextEnglish: I'm going to measure your blood pressure now. Please extend your arm, palm up, and relax.
TextGerman: Ich werde jetzt Ihren Blutdruck messen. Bitte strecken Sie Ihren Arm aus, Handfläche nach oben, und entspannen Sie sich.

TextEnglish: Your blood pressure is 136/80 mmHg. We'll keep an eye on that.
TextGerman: Ihr Blutdruck liegt bei 136/80 mmHg. Wir werden das im Auge behalten.

TextEnglish: Alright
TextGerman: Alles klar.

TextEnglish: Now, I'll check your heart rate.
TextGerman: Jetzt werde ich Ihre Herzfrequenz messen.

TextEnglish: Any history of heart conditions or irregular heartbeats?
TextGerman: Gab es in der Vergangenheit Herzerkrankungen oder unregelmäßigen Herzschlag?

TextEnglish: Okay, I'm going to check your heart rate now. Please stay still for a moment.
TextGerman: Okay, I'm going to check your heart rate now. Please stay still for a moment.

TextEnglish: Your heart rate is 96 beats per minute. It's slightly elevated, but that can be due to pain and stress.
TextGerman: Your heart rate is 96 beats per minute. It's slightly elevated, but that can be due to pain and stress.

TextEnglish: Okay
TextGerman: Okay

TextEnglish: Next, I'll measure your respiratory rate.
TextGerman: Next, I'll measure your respiratory rate.

TextEnglish: Have you experienced any shortness of breath or breathing difficulties lately?
TextGerman: Have you experienced any shortness of breath or breathing difficulties lately?

TextEnglish: No, but it's a bit hard to breathe because of the pain.
TextGerman: No, but it's a bit hard to breathe because of the pain.

TextEnglish: I'll observe your respiratory rate for a minute.
TextGerman: I'll observe your respiratory rate for a minute.

TextEnglish: Your respiratory rate is 20 breaths per minute. Again, this could be related to the pain.
TextGerman: Your respiratory rate is 20 breaths per minute. Again, this could be related to the pain.

TextEnglish: Yes, it hurts.
TextGerman: Yes, it hurts.

TextEnglish: Now, let's check your temperature.
TextGerman: Now, let's check your temperature.

TextEnglish: Any recent fever or chills?
TextGerman: Any recent fever or chills?

TextEnglish: No, I've been feeling fine in that regard.
TextGerman: No, I've been feeling fine in that regard.

TextEnglish: Your temperature is 36.5 degrees Celsius, which is normal.
TextGerman: Your temperature is 36.5 degrees Celsius, which is normal.

TextEnglish: That's good to know.
TextGerman: That's good to know.

TextEnglish: Finally, I'll measure your oxygen saturation.
TextGerman: Finally, I'll measure your oxygen saturation.

TextEnglish: Any history of lung problems or issues with oxygen levels?
TextGerman: Any history of lung problems or issues with oxygen levels?

TextEnglish: No, I've never had any lung issues.
TextGerman: No, I've never had any lung issues.

TextEnglish: Great. I'll place this oximeter on your finger to measure your oxygen saturation.
TextGerman: Great. I'll place this oximeter on your finger to measure your oxygen saturation.

TextEnglish: pulse_oxy
Your oxygen saturation is 98%, which is excellent.
TextGerman: Your oxygen saturation is 98%, which is excellent.

TextEnglish: That's a relief.
TextGerman: That's a relief.

TextEnglish: Given your symptoms, we'll need to perform some additional tests. First, we'll need a blood test to check for any signs of infection or inflammation. Secondly, we'll schedule an urgent ultrasound to further evaluate your condition.
TextGerman: Given your symptoms, we'll need to perform some additional tests. First, we'll need a blood test to check for any signs of infection or inflammation. Secondly, we'll schedule an urgent ultrasound to further evaluate your condition.

TextEnglish: Is that okay with you?
TextGerman: Is that okay with you?

TextEnglish: Yes, that sounds necessary.
TextGerman: Yes, that sounds necessary.

TextEnglish: I'll make sure these are scheduled for you
TextGerman: I'll make sure these are scheduled for you

TextEnglish: If you have any more questions or concerns, please feel free to ask.
TextGerman: If you have any more questions or concerns, please feel free to ask.

TextEnglish: Thank you, Ann. I appreciate your care and thoroughness.
TextGerman: Thank you, Ann. I appreciate your care and thoroughness.
